clinical_study.brief_title: Smartphone Delivered Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for Adolescents With Longstanding Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Smartphone Delivered Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for Adolescents With Longstanding Pain - a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Intervention study with uncontrolled design investigating the effects of smartphone delivered Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for longstanding pain in adolescents. Primary outcome is pain interference. Internet-based parental support will be offered to the adolescents' caregivers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, weekly for eight weeks (during treatment), after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: Change in pain interference on the adolescent daily activities. Items are rated on a 7-point Likert scale, and the total score is the mean of the completed items. Higher scores indicate more interference.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in quality of life for the adolescent. This questionnaire is composed of four subscales: Physical functioning (8 items), Emotional functioning (5 items), Social functioning (5 items), and School functioning (5 items). Each item has a scoring between 0 and 4, where a higher score indicate a better health-related quality of life. The subscales are summed together to a total score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale for Children (CES-DC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in depressive symptoms for the adolescent. Scores on the CES-DC are summed to a total score, ranging from 0 to 60, in which higher scores suggest a greater presence of depressive symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up).
secondary_outcome.description: Change in insomnia severity for the adolescent. Scores on the seven items are summed into a total score, ranging from 0 to 28, where higher scores indicate greater severity of insomnia.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, weekly for eight weeks (during treatment), after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in psychological flexibility for the adolescent. PIPS is composed on two subscales: Avoidance (8 items) and Defusion (4 items). Each item has a scoring ranging between 0 and 6. Scores are summed into subscales and into a total scale. Higher scores indicate higher degree of psychological inflexibility.

other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
other_outcome.description: Change in pain reactivity for the parent in relation to the child's pain. Each of the five items of the PRS-P is rated on a scale from 0 to 6, and summed together, with a maximum total score of 30. Higher scores indicate more pain reactivity.

other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
other_outcome.description: Change in psychological flexibility for the parent. A ten item questionnaire, with item scoring between 0 and 6. The PPFQ is summed into three subscales: Emotional acceptance (4 items), Values-based action (3 items), and Pain willingness (3 items). The subscales are also summed to a total score, where higher scores indicate more flexibility.

other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
other_outcome.description: Change in depressive symptoms for the parent. PHQ-9 is a nine item inventory summed into a total scale, with scores ranging from 0 to 27. Higher scores indicate more depressive symptoms.

other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-treatment, after 8 weeks (i.e. post-treatment), 8 weeks and 4 months after treatment is completed (i.e. 4 months follow-up), 8 weeks and 1 year after treatment (i.e. 1 year follow-up)
other_outcome.description: Change in anxiety symptoms for the parent. GAD-7 is a seven item inventory summed into a total scale, with scores ranging from 0 to 21. Higher scores indicate more anxiety.

arm_group.description: Eight weeks of smartphone delivered Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for the adolescent and eight weeks of internet delivered parental support to one or two parents of the adolescent.

intervention.description: Eight weeks of smartphone delivered Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for the adolescent and eight weeks of internet delivered parental support to one or two parents of the adolescent.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pain duration of â‰¥ 3 months;
- the pain condition has been examined by a medical doctor
- able to communicate in Swedish
- access to a smartphone and internet connection on a daily basis
- stable medication use since 2 months time, with no planned changes
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous ACT or CBT treatment during the past 6 months
- severe psychiatric co-morbidity (e.g. psychosis or high risk of suicide) as assessed by the psychologist in a semi-structured interview
